summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and with perjury related to 2016 depositions. The document outlines the allegations of grooming and abuse spanning from 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and committing perjury in 2016 depositions. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and co-conspirator with Ghislaine Maxwell in the sexual abuse of minor girls as young as 14, with abuse occurring at his residences.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and statement detailing the charges against Ghislaine Maxwell and her alleged role in the crimes.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the New York Field Office of the FBI
persons.context: Provided a statement commending the victims' bravery and detailing the FBI's role in the investigation.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Provided a statement condemning the crimes and commending investigators.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge assigned to preside over Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to sexually abuse minor girls, with Maxwell facilitating, grooming, and participating in the abuse of victims for Epstein.
Maxwell is alleged to have delivered minor victims to Epstein for sexual abuse and was sometimes present during the abuse.

events.title: Arrest and Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged in Manhattan federal court with conspiracy to sexually abuse minors with Jeffrey Epstein, and with perjury.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse
events.description: The timeframe during which Maxwell and Epstein are alleged to have exploited girls as young as 14, grooming and sexually abusing them at various residences.

events.title: False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell made several false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding, leading to perjury charges.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including charges of enticing and transporting minors for illegal sex acts.
The alleged abuse occurred from at least 1994 to 1997, with victims as young as 14 years old, at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, and at Maxwell's London residence.
Maxwell is charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath during 2016 depositions in a civil proceeding.
The indictment alleges Maxwell played a critical grooming role, befriending victims, normalizing sexual topics, and being present during sexual abuse by Epstein.
The case is being prosecuted by the SDNY Public Corruption Unit and is assigned to U.S. District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
